item.title: Skybound Games Faces $4 Million Lawsuit From iam8bit Over Fraud Claims
item.content:encoded:
Skybound Game Studios, the gaming subsidiary of Robert Kirkman’s Skybound Entertainment, is facing a sizeable lawsuit filed by iam8bit. This lawsuit alleges fraud, a breach of contract, and theft of original designs, and it was taken to the LA Superior Court for consideration.

The filing claims that Skybound has failed to explain financial discrepancies logged over the years of the partnership between the two firms, amongst other things. This has left iam8bit to file a considerable claim against Skybound.

Skybound Faces Allegations of Financial Misconduct

Skybound Game Studios and iam8bit entered into a partnership in April 2021, and according to the complaint, Skybound has always failed to deliver monthly financial reports as agreed and has added ‘millions of dollars in fake line items’ to expense reports.

It was explained that an impartial auditor was introduced to the debate, and even then, Skybound couldn’t explain the finances.

Beyond financial woes, iam8bit has accused Skybound Games of cutting it out of a deal related to Stray, the dystopian indie smash hit that launched on PlayStation in 2022. It was claimed that Skybound used original designs created by iam8bit for promotional purposes to secure a separate deal for a Nintendo Switch release of the game.

It has been argued that Skybound has exploited trade secrets while scalping iam8bit’s creative output for marketing purposes.

This leaves iam8bit’s legal team to seek monetary damages, some kind of punitive reform, and compensation for legal fees.

Skybound Games has refused to comment on the lawsuit thus far.

item.title: FURIA Has Perfect Budapest Push to Secure Playoff Spot
item.content:encoded:
FURIA has stormed into the playoffs of the StarLadder Budapest Major, completing a flawless 3-0 run through the tournament’s third stage to cement their dominance over rivals G2 in Hungary. Heading into the series, the head-to-head between the two was locked at 3-3, but FURIA shattered that ratio with a decisive 2-0 win.

It was an intense series that left FURIA one step closer to lifting the trophy in Budapest.

The predictions don’t end with this article, though. Insider Gaming, together with the international betting brand GG.BET, brings you to the heart of unforgettable moments of the Starladder Major Budapest 2025. Visit gg.bet to dive deeper, place your bets, and feel the adrenaline of esports!

FURIA in the Fight for First

The opening map in the series, Inferno, provided FURIA with early leverage, as the team secured a commanding 13-5 win over G2. It was a shock-and-awe mission for FURIA, with FalleN and YEKINDAR putting out multi-kills that left G2 flailing in the wind for much of the map.

Overpass came next, and again, FURIA was swinging around the map with reckless abandon. Even a brief respite provided by SunPayus with a clean pistol clapback wasn’t enough to recover those lost rounds.

In a post-match statement, Sid ‘sidde’ Macedo explained:

We were still deciding if we would full buy or not. I knew we needed a pause to organize our ideas, and FalleN came up with a very good plan of playing off the stacks, playing with numbers, and playing with smokes. Everyone contributed, and I’m glad I called the pause to bring it together.

This victory effectively breaks the deadlock with G2 and extends FURIA’s dominant streak at the Budapest Major in Hungary. The Brazilian side scooped trophies going into the Major, and now they’re looking to add another to that cabinet.

item.title: EA Has “No Plans” To Make A New Dead Space
item.content:encoded:
Electronic Arts (EA) isn’t looking to bring back Dead Space in the near future. 

As first reported on the latest episode of Insider Gaming Weekly, sources have told Insider Gaming that the series has been put “on ice”. That’s based on internal messaging happening within the company.

Sources added that with the direction of EA, they don’t expect the series to be picked back up anytime soon. That includes the idea of a remake, reboot, or sequel.

That said, there is still of a future for the 17-year-old series. With reports that the Saudi Arabia Public Investment Funt being in a tough spot financially after the EA sale, those who spoke under the condition of anonymity are hoping that EA, under the new ownership, would want to sell the IP.

This isn’t saying EA is actively looking to sell the series. This is from talking with a few people in the company that feel EA could sell it to try and pay off the debt and recoup some of the money after the deal closes next year.

What are your hopes for the future of Dead Space? Leave your thoughts down below and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Eidos Montreal Worked on Kojima’s ‘OD’ Before Being Asked to Move to Japan
item.content:encoded:
Insider Gaming has learned that Eidos Montreal worked with Kojima Productions on the developer’s new game ‘OD’ for around a year before some of its developers were asked to move to Japan.

According to sources who added further context to our past report on the current layoff situation at Eidos Montreal, OD, which was previously known as Overdose, had been in development there for around a year in 2023. The game was internally known as P21, but development of the project at Eidos Montreal ceased after a request from Kojima Productions to have the developers move to Japan and cut ties with Eidos Montreal, said the people.

At the time of the request, around 20 developers were working on the project.

Kojima’s ‘Overdose’ title suffered a monumental leak in November 2022, when gameplay footage obtained from the backend of YouTube by a leaker known as ‘The Snitch’ surfaced online. The two minutes of gameplay revealed that the game featured Death Stranding’s Mama (Margaret Qualley) in a blue dress and officially leaked the working name of the game as ‘Overdose’.

In 2023 at The Game Awards, Kojima officially announced with Jordan Peele that the game would be called ‘OD’, saying that people would “either love it or hate it”. In September 2025, a new teaser for the game, titled ‘Knock’, was released.

The game has seen several setbacks since its announcement, with filming for the game being delayed until 2026 due to the 2024–2025 SAG-AFTRA video game strike. On November 23, 2025, Ubo Kier, who was set to star in the game died at the age of 81.

Kojima said in a statement on X,

“I’m at a loss for words. It all happened far too suddenly. Because of the strike, we weren’t able to shoot “OD” for a long time, and we were forced to reschedule to next year. Even during that time, Udo and I exchanged emails frequently. We stayed in close contact. When we met in Milan at the end of September, he told me how much he was looking forward to the shoot starting up again next year. He was full of energy then too, making me laugh with his usual “Udo-isms.” I still can’t believe this. Udo wasn’t just an actor. He was truly an “icon” of his time. We’ve lost a great “icon.” There will never be another like him. Udo, rest in peace. I will never forget you.”

It’s currently unknown when the game will officially be released, but it will be published by Xbox Game Studios.

item.title: Amazon’s God of War May Have Cast Thor and Baldur
item.content:encoded:
A rumor from a reliable film insider may have revealed who’s cast as Thor and Baldur in Amazon’s God of War series. The show was recently given a two-season greenlight, with casting underway.

Ever since 2005, PlayStation and Santa Monica’s God of War series has delivered on the action front. With excellent drama, fun hack-and-slash gameplay, and gory godly kills, there’s a lot to love. The reboot series, consisting of God of War and God of War Ragnarok, put a more dramatic twist on the series, earning it huge praise. In 2022, it was announced that Amazon Prime Video would be making the reboots into a streaming show. Earlier last month, Emmy-winning director Frederick E.O. Toye was revealed to direct the first two episodes, with the casting ongoing. Now, it seems a new rumor says that actors for Thor and Baldur are close to being cast.

Boots and Severance Stars In Talks to Play Baldur and Thor in Amazon’s God of War, According to Film Insider

The rumor comes from reliable film insider DanielRPK, who’s leaked details on several projects like Avengers and Spider-Man. In a Patreon post, it’s mentioned that antagonists Baldur and Thor have actors in talks to play them for Amazon’s God of War. For Baldur, Max Parker, who recently played the lead in Boots, is up for the role of the Norse immortal. Meanwhile, Olafur Darri Olafsson, known for his role as Mr. Drummond in season two of Severance, is in talks to play the drunken god of thunder from Ragnarok, Thor.

It’s important to note that these castings have not been confirmed, so take it with a big grain of salt. Even if not, both actors are pretty great choices for the roles in God of War. As of now, no official casting has been revealed. Filming is expected to start early next year, so it won’t be long until it’s known who Kratos and Atreus are.
